name: Yam and Egg Sauce
description: A classic Nigerian breakfast dish made with yam and a spicy tomato-based egg sauce.

name: Plantain Pancakes
description: Fluffy pancakes made with ripe plantains and topped with fresh fruit.

name: Moi Moi (Bean Pudding)
description: A popular Nigerian breakfast made with black-eyed peas, peppers, onions, and spices.

name: Boiled Plantain and Egg Sauce
description: A simple and satisfying Nigerian breakfast of boiled plantains and a spicy tomato-based egg sauce.

name: Bread and Omelette
description: A classic Nigerian breakfast of fluffy omelette served with sliced bread.

name: Oatmeal
description: A warm and hearty breakfast dish made with oats, milk, and your choice of toppings.

name: Yam Porridge (Asaro)
description: A savory porridge made with yam, vegetables, and seasonings.

name: Plantain Frittata
description: A hearty breakfast dish made with plantains, eggs, and vegetables.

name: Akara and Pap
description: A traditional Nigerian breakfast of black-eyed pea fritters and a cornmeal porridge.

name: Yam and Fried Egg
description: A simple and satisfying breakfast dish of yam and a fried egg.

name: Pancakes
description: Fluffy pancakes served with your choice of toppings.

name: Fried Rice and Chicken
description: A flavorful Nigerian dish made with rice, vegetables, and chicken that's been marinated in a spicy sauce.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry with Grilled Chicken
description: A healthy and flavorful Nigerian dish made with stir-fried vegetables and grilled chicken.

name: Moi Moi and Custard
description: A popular Nigerian dish made with black-eyed peas, peppers, onions, and spices, served with custard.

name: Fried Plantains with Stewed Beans
description: A classic Nigerian dish made with fried plantains and a spicy stewed bean sauce.

name: Fried Rice and Beef Stew
description: A hearty and flavorful Nigerian dish made with rice, vegetables, and beef stew.

name: Grilled Fish and Fried Plantains
description: A delicious and filling Nigerian dish made with grilled fish and fried plantains.

name: Pepper Soup and Suya
description: A spicy and flavorful Nigerian dish made with a hot pepper soup and suya, a popular street food made with grilled beef or chicken.

name: Grilled Turkey and Coleslaw
description: A healthy and flavorful Nigerian dish made with grilled turkey and a side of coleslaw.

name: Ofada Rice with Fried Chicken
description: A traditional Nigerian dish made with Ofada rice, a locally grown variety of rice, and fried chicken.

name: Jollof Spaghetti with Fried Fish
description: A delicious Nigerian dish made with spaghetti cooked in a spicy tomato-based sauce and served with fried fish.

name: Fried Rice and Chicken
description: A flavorful Nigerian dish made with rice, vegetables, and chicken that's been marinated in a spicy sauce.

name: Peppered Snails and Soda
description: A spicy Nigerian dish made with snails and served with soda.

name: Afang Soup and Pounded Yam
description: A flavorful Nigerian soup made with afang leaves and served with pounded yam.

name: Stewed Beans and Fried Plantains
description: A classic Nigerian dish made with stewed beans and served with fried plantains.

name: Edikang Ikong Soup and Eba
description: A flavorful Nigerian soup made with a variety of vegetables and served with eba, a type of cassava-based dough.

name: Ewedu Soup and Amala
description: A traditional Nigerian soup made with ewedu leaves and served with amala, a type of yam-based dough.

name: Nkwobi (Cow Foot) and Beer
description: A popular Nigerian dish made with cow foot and served with beer.

name: Okra Soup with Fufu
description: A delicious and filling Nigerian soup made with okra and served with fufu, a type of cassava-based dough.

name: Banga Soup and Pounded Yam
description: A hearty Nigerian soup made with palm fruit and served with pounded yam.

name: Egusi Soup and Semovita
description: A rich and flavorful Nigerian stew made with ground melon seeds and served with semovita, a type of cassava-based dough.

name: Efo Riro and Eba
description: A classic Nigerian dish made with spinach, tomatoes, and bell peppers, served with eba, a type of cassava-based dough.
